title: Support Champiom Mastery???
body:
I just read the Patch Notes for patch 6.13 and was suprised to see that champion mastery for supports wasn't in there. On a post from Riot they said they knew Supports were having trouble recieving S's in game because of how it is calculated. 

I guess this question is more meant for a Rioter than anyone. Anyways, is the ward experience and the item buffs suppose to be the help supports need to get the S? Cause if so Thank You! but if not what happened? Did you decide its actually not that bad? I just want to know im feeling a little gimped since I saw nothing about this topic in the Patch Notes.

replies.body: Changes to Support grades in Champ Mastery took a bit longer than hoped unfortunately. Current prediction is they should be in 6.14 instead though.
Are you able to now or will they with the announcement tell us what changed about it? I know the system is kept vague intentionally, but more vague info is still welcome :3

Hopefully games like this become an S:

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2228189695/42846069?tab=stats

* 73% kill participation
* Most wards placed in the game (almost 2x anyone else, almost 3x enemy support )
* Most wards killed in the game
* Most wards bought in the game
* More damage dealt to enemy champions than the enemy Irelia top 
* Healing only behind Vlad and Soraka, because that's where it's suppose to be

Oh, but 1 death. No S.
If you had stolen 2 more kills it would have been an S.

Hi. I just saw this 1 DEATH NO S and I wanted to tell you that last time I played Soraka (last week, ranked game, I am platinum), I did something like 3/9/39 and I got S, so, I don't know what are you talking about :d

Oh wow, first time I ask a question to a rioter and got a response first try. :D
Anyways, thank you! I just wanted to know.

Thanks for asking this question. I want to get level six (hopefully seven) mastery with Nam-Nams someday myself, and I was curious as to why the patch notes left this out. Glad to hear it's still coming. I'm so happy they're acknowledging this. 

May the tides carry you to victory!

I thought my post was a little ironic. Before I even saw the post about the mastery change i needed 1 more S and was having a very hard time getting that last one for mastery 7. 

After I posted this I played 2 games and the second one I got an S and was able to get mastery 7. 

But I understand that there is a problem. I dont know if you have to win to get a S+ but I went 6/0/35...lost...but got only an S but i didnt care. Got my Mastery 7 Nami.

P.S. Good Luck to you in your champion mastery.
I remember that I got s+ for 5/1/+/-15 in 20 min on her.

and riot thought it was a good idea to not say anything about it, but let the user ask first? 

When does Riot get what communication is about?

I'm surprised it's that difficult to do.

I would have figured you've just got your various metrics for performance (probably as a percentile relative to others in that champ/role for each metric), and then various weightings for each of those metrics, and then it's all pulled together to produce a final performance score, which itself is looked at as a percentile to determine your final grade.

For supports, I feel like the biggest people most people have is the relative weighting of kills compared to assists. Options to address that include just looking at kills+assists and grading that as opposed to kills/assists separately, or just directly changings the weights (so being in the top 1% for kills on a support is only as impactful as being in the top 40% for assists or something).

Alternatively, perhaps you could be looking at entirely new metrics to consider (amount shielded/healed and that sort of thing), which would likely disproportionately impact support grading compared to other roles.

It'll be interesting to see what is produced. Hopefully some amount of detail will be given instead of a vague 'support grading has been tweaked'.

apparently i don't understand how supports are graded, because this game got me an S. Most deaths on my team, several of which were silly getting caught out while warding.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tMJaznz5,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-06-29T02:11:12.248+0000)
>
> Changes to Support grades in Champ Mastery took a bit longer than hoped unfortunately. Current prediction is they should be in 6.14 instead though.

The current system is pretty flawed.  You can go 0/0/20 as a support in a short and dominant win and not get an S.  You can also just farm, play safe, not worry about objectives, and get an S as a solo laner as your team gets completely destroyed.

As far as it goes people still do not understand how the champion mastery system works. 
It is based off of the average grading of that champion in your region. 
I.e {{champion:267}}  will have an average of 2/2/25 and 35 cs for an example. Get a certain percent over that and you will have succeeded.
The biggest issue that lies in supports is that a lot of games you will be lucky too get over 30 cs, and when you do, you might have only gotten 1 kill. 
So you may go 0/2/44 and 50 cs as {{champion:267}} , but you haven't succeeded the average kill count, and as a result, do not earn an S. 
There are times in which having exceedingly high Assists compared to Kills will override that statistic but it's all face value. 
This is one of the reasons why Sona's have the highest success rate when it comes to Earning S- and further rankings. Due to the fact her kit allows for accidental kills of CS and Enemies now and then.
I'm so sad. 2/0/20 Nami with most wards, most healing. A+ Meanwhile I've gotten S+ with 0/5/35 on Soraka. I honestly feel cheated with how the support masteries are :/
My duo just got level 7 Nami last night, in about a month and a half after I did on Lucian, I feel bad for him

It is because Champion Mastery heavily relies on CS and Kills (among other things) to get better ratings; two things supports shouldn't really be doing.  So getting rank 6/7 is hard to get S ratings, especially on your low damage supports like Soraka. I would be taking a guess, considering your rank, that you got a majority of the S games because you had damage runes/masteries/items over supportive ones.

Support main from Plat here. I also have an S on a lot of those champions. From what i understand, theyll weigh in things like warding etc more for us in the future. Personally, I can't wait - it's always a bit sad if you and your adc have been doing very well together, then they get an S and you end up with A+.
